Fatalities distributed across six events.

source: ABS CBN; HRW; Rappler; Amnesty International
notes: On 5 May 2020, the National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) in Quezon City ordered ABS CBN, the Philippines' largest broadcaster, to go off air, after its 25-year operating franchise expired the previous day and Congress failed to renew the said franchise. The order came even though the NTC assured in March that ABS CBN would be given a provisional authority to operate pending Congress' renewal of the franchise. The NTC order, which ABS CBN complied with, led to widespread condemnation from media, labor, and human rights groups locally and internationally. Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has often been critical of what it perceived as biased journalism from ABS CBN and other media outlets. Duterte had previously threatened to direct his allies in Congress to block the ABS CBN franchise renewal.

Maduro informed that one of the armed men was a U.S agent from the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), and the group of armed individuals was accused of attempting a coup d'etat. The same day, a National Guard (GNB) captain and a former U.S Green Beret released a video announcing that there are camps in Venezuela where people are preparing attacks on strategic targets. Opposition leader, Juan Guaido, denied any involvement. Another version came from a former minister who dismissed the regime's version and said that the armed clash was due to a war between drug cartels.

On 3 May, pro-Houthi forces announced that they had in fact killed the imam of the mosque, who was the IS Emir for Uthmah and Wusab districts, before correcting on 5 May that he was loyal to AQAP and not IS. Some, however, dismissed this claim as propaganda to cover the Houhi killing.
On 1 May 2020, an IED of unknown origin reportedly detonated and targeted a pro-Hadi Islah military truck directed at Al Alam military camp (Marib, Marib), killing 2 soldiers.

On 1 May 2020, protesters demonstrated in Dolapeta village (Srikakulam, AP) against the set up of a coronavirus quarantine center in the area. Police resorted to mild lathi charge to disperse the protesters. [size=no report]

Both sides suffered the death of one soldier while five pro-STC fighters were also reported injured before Saudi forces intervened to stop the clashes.
On 1 May 2020, 2 civilians were wounded and several houses were damaged when Afghan forces fired mortars in Zadran (Girda Chiri) district, Paktia.
On 1 May 2020, traders of a local open food market in Tbilisi organized a protest. They demanded that the market is reopened. The market had been closed down due to coronavirus. [size=no report]

[size=no report]

On 1 May 2020, a security guard fatally shot a man who was not wearing a face mask during the national coronavirus lockdown in Kimberley (Frances Baard, Northern Cape), during an altercation over entry into a shop at a filling station.

Around 1 May 2020 (week of), in San Salvador, law enforcement detained around a hundred of alleged gang members, including gang leaders. Reports indicate that 35 members the MS-13: Mara Salvatrucha were arrested, as they are seemingly behind the latest rise in homicides in the country and extortion.

On 1 May 2020, in the rural area of Contulmo, Biobio, at least 10 trucks and heavy machinery of a logging company were set on fire by a group of armed men. Perpetrators threatened the workers with guns, before setting the vehicles on fire. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 1 May 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, citizens marched on the streets of the city on the commemoration of Labor Day. The group demands job security for Chilean citizens and improvement in the economic measures to protect workers from the crisis prompted by the coronavirus pandemic. Police forces of Chile dispersed the group alluding to the group breach the rule of small gatherings due to the coronavirus pandemic. Police Forces of Chile reported 57 people arrested, among them journalists that were reporting the event. [size=at least 57]
As reported on 1 May 2020, Afghan forces 'bombarded' a compound of a civilian in the Shobar Killi area of Shah Joy district, Zabul.

notes: On 28 April 2020, clashes between hundreds of rioters demonstrating against the high US dollar exchange rate and dire economic and living conditions in Tripoli and Military forces continued until daw Tuesday, and clashes erupted again later that day. Rioters broke ATM's and set them on fire, hurled Molotov cocktails at two Police and one Military vehicles that burned, and hurled stones and a home-made crude explosive at soldiers. They also hurled stones and firecrackers at the house of MP Faisal Karami and clashed with soldiers. Military forces intervened and used live fire, rubber coated bullets and tear gas to disperse rioters. A rioter succumbed to his wounds on Tuesday, 47 people injured, 50 soldiers were injured, of which 6 are officers and 19 rioters were detained. [size=hundreds]

Military forces intervened and used live fire, rubber coated bullets and tear gas to disperse rioters. A rioter succumbed to his wounds on Tuesday, 30 people were injured as well as 40 soldiers, of which 6 are officers and 9 rioters were detained. [size=hundreds]

admin1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
notes: On 27 April 2020, an unidentified armed group that was storming the satellite office of a town mayor was engaged by responding MILF militants in a firefight in Barangay Gadungan, Sultan Sumagka (formerly Talitay), Maguindanao. The police later arrived and came to the aid of the MILF, after which the unidentified armed group withdrew. The MILF recently began decommissioning its weapons as part of the 2014 peace plan. In recent years, they have assisted the military in fighting Islamist groups in the region. Police said a political rivalry was the likely motive for the attack on the office.
